conbody.p: Currently, the Java SDK is in a beta release state, so you need to include the Couchbase Maven Repository if you want to pull it in automatically. Here is a typical `pom.xml` that you can copy and paste:

You can also download an archive which has all jars and dependencies included, but in general using a package manager is strongly recommended. Once the final version is released, it will be distributed through maven central and you can omit the custom repository definition.
If you import the dependency, here is the list of transitive dependencies that will also be added:

ol.li: core-io: our internal core library, which abstracts lots of couchbase-specific behavior in a language neutral way.
RxJava: a foundational library to build reactive and asynchronous applications.

conbody.p: Note that at least Java 6 is required, but any newer version is also supported (including the newly released Java 8).
